The Bastille (French pronunciation: [bastij]) was a fortress in Paris, known 
formally as the Bastille Saint-Antoine. It played an important role in the internal 
conflicts of France and for most of its history was used as a state prison by the 
kings of France. It was stormed by a crowd on 14 July 1789, in the French 
Revolution, .... The resulting structure became known simply as the Bastille, with 
the eight...
